Another key aspect of decarbonization regards issues of acceptability and social inclusion in decision
making. Participatory processes involving stakeholders can be implemented using several methods to

Implications for the modelling of technical change in decarbonization pathways
Although the debate is still ongoing, preliminary conclusions indicate that integrated assessment
models tend to underestimate innovation on energy sup
ply but overestimate the contributions by energy

of a given technology and its speed of diffusion

Comparing observed energy technology costs and deployment rates with projections
Currently observed costs and deployment for electricity supply technologies from a variety of sources
are compared with projections from two different sets of scenarios contained in the AR6 Scenario
database: 1) reference and current policies including NDC
database). Global aggregate costs are shown for the following technologies: Coal with CCS, Gas with
CCS, Nuclear, Solar PV, Onshore and Offshore Wind.
The decrease in forecasted capital costs is not large compare
d to current capital costs for most
technologies, and does not differ much between the two scenarios (Box 16.1, Figure 1a). For Wind
offshore some of the models are more optimistic than the current reality
sources of current solar PV costs report values that are at the low end of the AR6 model scenario
dian technology cost forecasts decrease by between 5% for nuclear and 45
